questions.questionText: Which of the following does HTML use to specify elements?
questions.explanation: HTML uses the opening angle bracket (<) to specify elements

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a valid CSS selector?
questions.explanation: enum is not a valid CSS selector

questions.questionText: How can we apply styles to an element using JavaScript?
questions.explanation: JavaScript functions are used to apply styles to an element dynamically

questions.questionText: How can we select an element using its ID in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: document.getElementById('id') is used to select an element by its ID

questions.questionText: Which of these methods is used to add a class to an element in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: element.classList.add('className') is used to add a class to an element

questions.questionText: Which is NOT a valid value for the CSS display property?
questions.explanation: async is not a valid value for the CSS display property

questions.questionText: Which property is used to change the font size in CSS?
questions.explanation: font-size is used to specify the size of the font in CSS

questions.questionText: Which is a valid value for the CSS background color property?
questions.explanation: All of the options are valid values for the CSS background color property

questions.questionText: How can we select multiple elements in JavaScript using a class?
questions.explanation: document.getElementsByClassName('className') is used to select multiple elements by class name

questions.questionText: How can we change the text content of an HTML element using JavaScript?
questions.explanation: element.innerText is used to change the text content of an HTML element
